Great videos! I love to watch and learn new things. I just have one suggestion-- I think you should be more specific when talking about twins having the same genomes (5:33) because there are a lot of misconceptions about identical vs. Fraternal twins. I know you specified identical earlier on, but most people don't realize that fraternal twins aren't any more similar or different than any other siblings would be-- and that they DO NOT have the same genome. Just a small thought! I think it would actually be kind of cool if you did a video about the differences between identical and fraternal twins. Anyway, I am just pointing this out because I have heard many people say incorrect generalizations about ALL twins.

It could be that what we measured when Astronaut Scott Kelly  returned to Earth was the after effects of the time dilation felt by the telomeres as his cells traveled at a slower time rate due to his higher velocity and thereby ageing slower than his twin brother's telomers back on Earth. If so, this could be become experimental biological evidence of Einstein's theory!

Clearly Hank does not watch Space Weather News. The YouTube channel SuspiciousObservers can inform you about the "global electric circut" and the "electric universe" models that explain how that plasma, and ejecta (when it leaves the sun) are composed of all the elements on the periodic table and create a path for electricity to flow out from the sun. The ejecta, from a coronal mass ejection, and electrolysis in our atmosphere is the most likely source of water on earth. Our electromagnetic shield makes an atmosphere possible, otherwise solar wind would blow away the gas surrounding our planet. Under the earth's crust there are "earth spot" events that guide major weather patterns above the crust. I am an environmentalist, but our climate and weather are guided by solar cycles with punctuated equallibrium from comets and large asteroids. It's possible that our planet passes through a few different patches of space rocks, making a cycle out of the cosmic events as well. Our ancient ancestors would not have been able to make the zodiac calendars if they did not know about thousands of years of cosmic documentation. That's simple logic. 12,800ish years ago one large comet wiped out whatever culture was around while hunter gatherers were able to survive because they were not weakened by the social structures our species creates. Basically if you depend upon the grocery store, you won't survive as long as people who regularly go hunting and grow food. Subways will leave traces of our cave paintings if the same thing happens again.
